items.summary: Update the site viewport configuration by replacing the existing viewport meta tag in `frontend/index.html` with exactly: `<meta name="viewport" content="width=device-width, initial-scale=1, viewport-fit=cover" />`.

Add a global, mobile-safe overflow prevention baseline in `frontend/src/index.css` to fully eliminate horizontal scrolling: apply `width: 100%`, `margin: 0`, and `overflow-x: hidden` to `html, body`, and ensure `#root` is `width: 100%` with `min-height: 100vh`.

Ensure the premium dark gradient background covers the full screen width/height on mobile by applying the background to either `body` or a single full-width top-level wrapper (e.g., the `App` root) using `width: 100vw` (or `w-full`) and `min-height: 100vh`, without introducing horizontal overflow.

Audit and fix layout containers and section components to remove any non-responsive fixed width constraints that can force overflow (e.g., `w-[400px]`, `w-[420px]`, `w-[450px]`, or problematic `max-w-[500px]`). Replace them with mobile-first responsive patterns (`w-full`, optional `max-w-[480px]`, `mx-auto`, and `px-4` / `p-4` / `p-6`) so content stretches correctly on small screens.

Identify and eliminate the specific DOM element(s) causing right-side overflow (e.g., oversized absolutely positioned layers, transforms, fixed alignment, or any element wider than 100%). Adjust the offending styles/classes so no element exceeds the viewport width on mobile while keeping existing UI behavior intact.
